page.title: 05CHURCH BARTON FARM
page.content:
There are four hundred acres growing barley, wheat and rape. The rape is used for cooking oil. {One man}looks after the whole farm except at harvest and sowing times. Last year the harvesting was done during two weeks in August and the seeds were sown by the middle of September. When the present farm labourer started work on this farm forty years ago, there were forty workers.
The main reasons why there are less workers are the use of{chemicals}and {machinery}including combine harvesters tractors, ploughs, sprays and turbo-choppers. The plough we saw had eight large blades.
They have a lot of trouble with{pests, especially foxes, rabbits and brent geese which come in the winter.
